explains: n. 代理人，替代者；代孕母亲；（基督教）（签发结婚证书的）主教代理人；遗嘱检验法官
v. 取代，替代；指定（某人）为自己的代理人
wordGroup: surrogate mother n. 代孕母亲；替身母亲

sentences.en: She saw him as a sort of surrogate father.
sentences.cn: 在她心目中，他仿佛是能替代父亲角色的人。

sentences.en: He found a psychotherapist near him to supervise his work with a surrogate, and flew the surrogate there from Los Angeles.
sentences.cn: 他发现一名心理治疗师和一名代理在他旁边监督他的工作，并让代理从洛杉矶飞往那里。

sentences.en: The resulting hybrid grew into a tiny embryo known as a blastocyst, implanted into the womb of a surrogate mother, and went on to become Dolly.
sentences.cn: 由此产生的杂交后代长成了一个名为胚泡的小胚胎，被植入代孕母亲的子宫，然后变成了多莉。
